parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started)
fields.implementationNotes: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the ECG finding category, if not on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.
fields.label: Category for ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the ECG finding?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not an ECG or specific ECG test was done.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: ECG Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF="N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF="Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: EGPERF
fields.questionText: Was the ECG performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGREPNUM

fields.completionInstructions: Record which repetition of the ECG this is.
fields.definition: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a timepoint, within a visit; multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).
fields.implementationNotes: If there are multiple ECGs, this is used to record in which order this ECG occurred.
fields.label: ECG Repetition Number
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGREPNUM
fields.questionText: Which repetition of the ECG is this?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGREFID

fields.definition: An internal or external identifier of the ECG (e.g., waveform number)
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer if this reference ID happens to be available to the site at the time of collection. Examples: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) for external waveform file, session number automatically generated by electronic equipment. This can also be used to link.
fields.label: ECG Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: EGREFID
fields.questionText: What was the (ECG) [reference identifier/accession number]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71151

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGMETHOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method used for the ECG.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination
fields.implementationNotes:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.
fields.label: Method of ECG Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the ECG?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90013

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGLEAD

self.title: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement

fields.completionInstructions: Record which lead was used for this measurement.
fields.definition: The lead used for the measurement (e.g., "LEAD I", "LEAD II", "LEAD III", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1")
fields.implementationNotes: This is used when more specificity for the location is desired for the ECG data.
fields.label: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGLEAD
fields.questionText: Which lead location was used for this measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGPOS

fields.completionInstructions: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.
fields.definition: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement
fields.implementationNotes:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Position of the subject is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Position of the subject is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.
fields.label: ECG Position of Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGPOS
fields.questionText: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date the ECG was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: Date of ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EGDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the ECG?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column heading.
fields.label: ECG Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.
fields.name: EGTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss)
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.
fields.label: Time of ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EGTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGEVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: ECG Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGEVAL
fields.questionText: Who provided the information?; Who was the evaluator?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record overall interpretations of the ECG.
fields.definition: Overall interpretation of the result of the measurement or finding
fields.implementationNotes: The overall interpretation of an ECG is mapped into the appropriate SDTM test and result variables. See the SDTMIG EG Domain for details.
fields.label: ECG Interpretation
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, the recorded interpretation is populated into the SDTMIG variable EGORRES where EGTEST= "Interpretation", and EGTESTCD="INTP".
fields.name: INTP_EGORRES
fields.questionText: What was the interpretation of the ECG?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGCLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether ECG results were clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication of whether the ECG results were clinically significant
fields.implementationNotes: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation. In this scenario, clinical significance could be provided by the investigator.
fields.label: ECG Clinical Significance \n
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEG dataset as the value of SUPPEG.QVAL where SUPPEG.QNAM = "EGCLSIG" and SUPPEG.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
fields.name: EGCLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the ECG clinically significant?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGMHNO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.
fields.definition: Identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the clinically significant ECG finding and the medical history event that was reported. EGMHNO can be used in RELREC to identify a relationship between records in EG dataset and records in the MH dataset. See the SDTMIG for information on creating RELREC.
fields.label: Related Medical History Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the MH domain.
fields.name: EGMHNO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading IA.EGAENO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the adverse event that was the reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.
fields.definition: Identifier for the adverse event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the clinically significant ECG finding and the AE that was reported. EGAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in EG dataset and records in the AE dataset. See the SDTMIG for information on creating RELREC.
fields.label: Related Adverse Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the AE domain.
fields.name: EGAENO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding?
